entries.title: How Hezbollah and Israel Have Kept the Lid on a Wider War
entries.description: Both sides have their reasons for calibrating their attacks to avoid a regional conflict.

entries.title: Ukraine’s Borderland, in Photos
entries.description: Photographs from two trips along Ukraine’s northeastern border regions, in the months before Russia renewed an offensive there, reveal loss and transformation.

entries.title: For the First French Town Liberated on D-Day, History Is Personal
entries.description: Some aging residents of Ste.-Mère-Église in Normandy can still recall the American paratroopers who dropped into their backyard. It’s been a love affair ever since.

category.#text: United States Defense and Military Forces

entries.title: The E.U. Is Voting. It’s Never Mattered More.
entries.description: Hundreds of millions of voters are electing a European Parliament this weekend. The outcome will help tip the balance of the continent’s struggle between unity and nationalism.

entries.title: Children Among Dozens Killed in Attack on Sudanese Village
entries.description: Videos showed paramilitaries opening fire on the village in what had been Sudan’s breadbasket region, causing the latest mass civilian casualties in a brutal yearlong war.

entries.title: Zelensky Shares Emotional Moment With U.S. Veteran at D-Day Ceremony
entries.description: The veteran, Melvin Hurwitz, embraced the Ukrainian president and called him “the savior of the people.” Mr. Zelensky told Mr. Hurwitz that he and his fellow World War II veterans had “saved Europe.”

entries.title: D-Day Photos: Veterans Remember Normandy Invasion on 80th Anniversary
entries.description: Veterans of the pivotal battle of World War II are disappearing. Europe, facing new conflict, recalls what their comrades died for.

entries.title: Biden’s D-Day Speech Links Fight for Ukraine With Allied Efforts
entries.description: Speaking in Normandy, the president argued that similar principles were at stake in both wars: the defense of freedom and a rules-based international order.

entries.title: Israeli Strike Kills Dozens at Former School Where Civilians Were Sheltering
entries.description: The Israeli military said it had targeted Hamas operatives at a U.N.-run school complex. Palestinian officials said the dead included women and children.

entries.title: Inside Sde Teiman, the Base Where Israel Detains Gazans
entries.description: Since Israel invaded Gaza, the Sde Teiman military base has filled with blindfolded, handcuffed detainees, held without charge or legal representation.

category.#text: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

entries.title: Russia Detains a French National Suspected of Collecting Military Data
entries.description: The detention is the latest in a series in which foreigners have been arrested or held against their will in Russia, exacerbating tensions with the West.

category.#text: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

entries.title: A Ukrainian City Becomes a Target of a New Russian Offensive
entries.description: Residents of Sumy, in northeastern Ukraine, repelled Moscow’s forces in 2022. Now, after months of punishing airstrikes, Ukrainian officials say the Kremlin is preparing a new offensive.

entries.title: In Global Elections, Strongmen Are Taken Down a Notch
entries.description: In Turkey, India and elsewhere, where some feared authoritarian leaders would consolidate power, democracy has proved surprisingly resilient.

entries.title: Train Crash in Czech Republic Kills 4, Injures More Than 20
entries.description: The passenger train was traveling overnight when it hit a freight train.

entries.title: Americans Head to New Zealand and Leave ‘the Chaos’ Behind
entries.description: The Pacific island nation has become an object of fascination for some Americans who no longer want to deal with the U.S. political divide.

entries.title: In New Caledonia, ‘No Confidence’ With France After Violent Protests
entries.description: An uneasy stalemate exists in the South Pacific territory as Paris continues to enforce a nightly curfew and a ban on the sale of alcohol.

entries.title: Friday Briefing
entries.description: What could come next for India.

entries.title: Netanyahu Is Set to Address Congress on July 24
entries.description: The political divide over the Israeli prime minister was evident even in the announcement of when he would appear, with Republican and Democratic leaders issuing separate statements.

entries.title: Israeli Military Defends Strike on Gaza School Building, Saying It Targeted 30 Militants
entries.description: Hamas and Islamic Jihad fighters were hiding inside three classrooms, a military spokesman said.

entries.title: Israeli Strike Kills Dozens at Civilian Shelter in Gaza
entries.description: The Israeli military said it had been targeting militants who were hiding in the complex in an effort to evade attack. The former U.N. school was housing 6,000 displaced Gazans.

category.#text: United Nations Relief and Works Agency

entries.title: Israeli Airstrike Sets off Chaos at Gazan Hospital
entries.description: Al Aqsa Martyrs Hospital, inundated by a rapidly rising casualty count, is so full that the crowds themselves are hampering treatment.

entries.title: Friday Briefing: Narendra Modi’s India
entries.description: We explain what to expect from his third term.

category.#text: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

entries.title: Mexico’s Presidents Get Only One Term. Is That a Good Thing?
entries.description: Examining the rare one-term presidential limit.

entries.title: South Africa’s President Announces Intent to Form National Unity Government
entries.description: President Cyril Ramaphosa’s party, the African National Congress, is seeking a broad alliance after it failed to win enough seats in last week’s election to form a government on its own.

entries.title: T.D. Allman, Assertive Globe-Trotting Journalist, Dies at 79
entries.description: Reporting from more than 80 countries, he combined close observation with sharp conclusions that pointed the finger at misdeeds or abuse of power. He was an author as well.

entries.title: Video Analysis Shows Israeli Strike Used Bomb That Appeared to Be U.S.-Made
entries.description: A video of munitions debris filmed at the school complex in central Gaza where thousands of Palestinians were sheltering showed remnants of a GBU-39, a bomb that is designed and manufactured by Boeing.

category.#text: United Nations Relief and Works Agency

entries.title: Gazans Weep and Pray Over Loved Ones Killed in U.N. School Strike
entries.description: The deadly strike on a United Nations school-turned-shelter is a bitter reminder, Gazans say, that each place they flee eventually gets caught up in the bloodshed.

entries.title: Search Underway in Greece for British TV Doctor Michael Mosley
entries.description: Mr. Mosley, a popular science journalist, disappeared while on a walk on the Greek island of Symi. He was last seen at a bus stop on Wednesday afternoon.

entries.title: European Central Bank Cuts Interest Rates for the First Time Since 2019
entries.description: The quarter-point reduction comes as inflation in the eurozone cools, prompting the E.C.B. to move before the Federal Reserve in the United States, where rates remain high.

entries.title: How a Backlash Against Climate Action Is Reshaping Europe’s Election
entries.description: After years of political consensus on the transition to cleaner energy, a ‘greenlash’ appears to be building as prices rise and right-wing candidates gain ground.

entries.title: An Oregon Forest Is in Trouble. Part of the Response: Logging.
entries.description: Officials in Oregon say they need to cut trees, including some healthy ones. The reaction shows how complex land management has become as forest health declines.

entries.title: The U.S. and 16 other countries call for a cease-fire deal, and other news.
Papua New Guinea to End Search for Landslide Victims
entries.description: The death toll remained unclear weeks after the tragedy, but there are signs the number of victims may have been much lower than previously thought.

entries.title: Santiago Power Outage Leaves Over 400,000 Without Electricity
entries.description: A tree fell on a high-voltage transmission tower early Thursday, knocking out power to parts of the Chilean capital.

entries.title: Thursday Briefing
entries.description: War in Sudan caused the world’s largest displacement crisis.

entries.title: Thursday Briefing: A Special Report From Sudan
entries.description: Also, the 80th anniversary of D-Day.

category.#text: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

entries.title: U.N. Nuclear Watchdog Censures Iran and Demands Access for Inspectors
entries.description: The International Atomic Energy Agency acted in the face of Iran’s refusal to allow experts to examine its stepped-up nuclear enrichment program.

entries.title: Biden’s New Order Leaves Migrants at Border in Limbo Over Asylum Fate
entries.description: In Mexican cities along the border with the United States, migrants were taking a wait-and-see approach to a restrictive new executive action.

entries.title: Netanyahu Threatens Military Action Against Hezbollah as Biden Pushes for Truce
entries.description: After a barrage from Hezbollah militants on northern Israel, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu threatened a “very intense” military response.

entries.title: Slovak Prime Minister Speaks Publicly for First Time Since Assassination Attempt
entries.description: Robert Fico said in a video address that he hoped to return to work in the coming weeks. He blamed the political opposition for the attack, a notion that the parties have strongly denied.

entries.title: A Russian American Is Sentenced in Russia Over Social Media Posts
entries.description: The latest detention of an American national in Russia has renewed fears that the Kremlin is seeking to use U.S. citizens as bargaining chips.

entries.title: 18 Arrested at Israeli Nationalist Flag March Through East Jerusalem
entries.description: The annual march celebrating Israel’s 1967 takeover of the mostly Palestinian East Jerusalem has long been a flashpoint.

entries.title: Getting a Cease-Fire in Gaza Has Been Hard. Fulfilling One Will Be Harder.
entries.description: The proposal backed by President Biden is deeply political and aims at stopping the war at least for now. But Israel rejects a permanent cease-fire and Hamas has its own reasons for reluctance.

entries.title: London Hospitals Face Major Disruptions After Cyberattack
entries.description: A system used by several major London hospitals was targeted in a ransomware cyberattack, forcing the cancellation of services and the diversion of patients.

entries.title: Pro Skier and Partner Fall to Their Deaths in the Italian Alps
entries.description: Jean Daniel Pession, a speed skier on the World Cup circuit, and his girlfriend, Elisa Arlian, fell more than 2,000 feet.

entries.title: Rahul Gandhi, Long on the Ropes, Looks Set for an Unexpected Comeback
entries.description: The Indian National Congress and its leader registered a far stronger showing in India’s elections than many expected.

entries.title: What to Know About the Latest Gaza Cease-Fire Proposal
entries.description: Neither Israel or Hamas have said definitively whether they would accept or reject a proposal outlined by President Biden, but sizable gaps between the two sides appear to remain.

entries.title: Narendra Modi Fell to Earth After Making It All About Himself
entries.description: The Indian leader used his singular persona to lift his party to new heights. Then the opposition found a way to use his cult of personality against him.

entries.title: Collectors Line Up in London as King Charles Bank Notes Are Released
entries.description: A steady stream of people lined up at the Bank of England on Wednesday to get what they hoped would be collector’s items: the first bank notes featuring the portrait of King Charles III.

category.#text: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

entries.title: ‘Hanging by a Thread’: U.N. Chief Warns of Missing a Key Climate Target
entries.description: His comments came as the world body’s weather agency said it expected Earth to soon surpass the record high temperatures experienced in 2023.

entries.title: Allies Warn Former Fighter Pilots Not to Train Chinese Military Members
entries.description: A new bulletin says China is trying to step up recruitment of Western-trained fighter pilots to improve its air combat capability.

category.#text: United States Defense and Military Forces

entries.title: The New Kingmakers Who Could Make or Break Modi’s Government
entries.description: Two veterans of bare-knuckled Indian politics have the Parliament votes the prime minister will need, but neither is aligned with his Hindu-first vision.

entries.title: Far-Right Politician Attacked With Box Cutter in Germany
entries.description: The authorities said the attack did not appear to be targeted. But it came days after members of an anti-Islam group were stabbed in the same city, raising fears about violence before E.U. elections.

entries.title: It’s Wedding Season: Here Come the Owls
entries.description: What better way to deliver the rings to the bride and groom?

entries.title: As Ukraine’s Summer Starts With Blackouts, Worries Over Winter Begin
entries.description: Recent rolling power outages have raised alarm about what will happen when cold weather arrives and energy consumption goes even higher.

entries.title: Israel Secretly Targets U.S. Lawmakers With Influence Campaign on Gaza War
entries.description: Israel’s Ministry of Diaspora Affairs ordered the operation, which used fake social media accounts urging U.S. lawmakers to fund Israel’s military, according to officials and documents about the effort.

entries.title: The D-Day Battle France Chose to Forget. Until Now.
entries.description: Far from Normandy’s beaches, French paratroopers and resistance members fought a rear-guard action to keep the Nazis at bay. But its tragic end had made it a battle to forget.

entries.title: Famine Looms in Sudan as Civil War Pushes Capital Toward Abyss
entries.description: A year of fighting has turned the once proud capital, Khartoum, into a charred battleground. Millions have fled. Now a famine threatens in one of Africa’s biggest countries.

entries.title: U.S. Embassy in Beirut Targeted With Gunfire
entries.description: An attacker was wounded and arrested, the Lebanese Army said. An embassy security guard was injured.
